channel.title: Learn Circuit Analysis on Tooabstractive
channel.description: Recent content in Learn Circuit Analysis on Tooabstractive

item.title: What Is Voltage, Current and Resistance In Simple Terms?
item.description: Content Summary Circuits are fascinating and can be found in our smartphones, computer, even the PS5 gaming pad and much more. A circuit or electric circuit is a close loop that allows the flow of electricity. The interconnections of circuit components without forming a closed loop is called electrical network. Voltage is the pressure or force applied to push current through a branch in a circuit.

item.title: Electronics Circuit Components And Their Functions Explained
item.description: Content Summary A battery is considered as one of the source of voltage. Resistor is a component that offers resistance to the flow of current in a circuit. Capacitor which in simple term is a passive device or component that stores charges or energy for a short period of time. An inductor works same way as the capacitor because they store charge but one of their difference is that it uses wounded conductors rather than capacitor that uses plates separated by air gap or dielectrics.

item.title: What Is Ohms Law In Simple Terms? And Why Is It Useful
item.description: Content Summary The ohms law is the fundamental law that relates voltage, current and resistance by using simple mathematical expressions. Ohms law is the law that most other techniques (e.g. kirchoffs law, nodal analysis and mesh analysis) are derived from. what is ohm's law and why do we need it The ohms law is the fundamental law that relates voltage, current and resistance by using simple mathematical expressions which says V = IR.

item.title: Series and parallel combination of resistors explained with how to identify them
item.description: Content Summary Resistors in series are connected head to tail. A resistor in series allows the same current to flow through them but different voltage will be dropped across them if their resistance value is different. Resistors in parallel are connected head to head and tail to tail. A resistor in parallel have same voltage but different current will be flowing through each resistor depending on their resistance value.

item.title: Star - Delta Transformation Explained With Tips On How To Recall The Formulas
item.description: Content Summary The star and delta transformation involves converting from star to delta or delta to star and we do this when our resistors are not connected in parallel or series. The delta can be structured in two ways as having a triangle shape or pie shape. The star has a wye or T shape. Why and how do we do star to delta or delta to star transformation The star and delta transformation involves converting from star to delta or delta to star and we do this when our resistors are not connected in parallel or series.
